topic.title: Snowden's Revelation and Result
topic.body: Was it worth it? Exposes a vast unconstitutional conspiracy to save the internets, and ends up in exile. Is this guy just naive? a bit slow? or overly idealistic? The American gov made new laws to make legal what what was and still is unconstitutional, and the only thing Snowden proved was, yes we are in a surveillance state. The Patriot Act provisions keep getting extended...fucking TSA its been 20 years now!! the FISA courts are still a rubber stamp....500,000,000 phone taps OK'd by one warrant WTF! Why are people not going down to the CIA, NSA, data centers and screaming murder, instead of groups of fat neck beard men, and purple haired 400lbs lesbian apes sitting on the corner talking about PEACE......go have another candle lighting ceremony like in Chicago for those who are shot, fake fucks!

1578268512_16Fw7LqBDEgoFYTkiJBsywYJRtoRR.body: the internet would have come about eventually, anyways I doubt the guy who designed it would have done so knowing shitlords like Bush,Obaobobo, Clapper would turn it against their own countrymen.

> [fib](#comment_49_1Drej4kKBea1TryGPYfVZgzDxaB71rsKkK): Go to the gates of your closest military base and camp out. Say what you think is wrong if you get asked. Hold a sign if you don't want to talk. [...]

Slaves are the lowest form. If you think you can get by read what the Romans thought about and did to the slaves they captured in battle. Better to die.

> [fib](#comment_51_1Drej4kKBea1TryGPYfVZgzDxaB71rsKkK): Then all of us Americans were born to die. There's nothing left to build for anyone whose life matters enough to justify the resources they will consume.

So we have souls and rights and a constitution that recognizes and organizes a confederation. But, if we have a leader that can dictate the future course of a nation based on his own common sense, then anyone's judgement would do just the same. Watching the Golden Globes; Ellen DeGeneres gets recognized for being a homosexual, and oppressed, Global Warming is mentioned over and over and over, and the people fleeing Australian wildfire are shown great sympathy.......Meanwhile in Russia.......Edward Snowden sits in a cold apartment, watching the snow fly, and his life slowly extinguish.

> [sfs9](#comment_1_1Ev2p6pn33TkPNNrMbNFwSspPzivpKaTKD): I have 2 aspects to it. First of all, the Edward Snowden's behaviour is as American as it gets. The shoddy escape planning, the sincere belief that if the ills of the Government are revealed to the public, then things will be OK and fixed, the sincere American patriotism of accepting the risks just in the name of doing the Right Thing for the America. In my view, he is certainly a hero, but unfortunately slightly stupid, naive hero. Was it worth it? Not the way he expected it to be, but in an unexpected way HUGELY WORTH IT. The way he was treated by the U.S. government and the various European governments PROOVED that in reality in the 21. century there is no way to tell publicly about the ill-doings of the Western governments without being the target of repressions. With China, Russia, Arab states that's kind of granted, but the fact that it also holds for the Western governments, not just the U.S., was TOTALLY NEW INFORMATION and interestingly I haven't read or heard the Edward Snowden itself ever talking about that aspect of his case. He just talks/writes about the revelations and mass surveillance, but the mass surveillance part is kind of irrelevant in a sense that thehttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ECHELONwas public knowledge long before his revelations became public and already in year 2003 or so we (as students) were told at our cryptography lecture that a good way to design software is to apply encryption whenever possible, because if there is an opportunity for some party to abuse the situation, it will get eventually abused. So, from that point of view, the existence of the mass surveillance project does not really change anything, because, well, if the software developers did their job properly, the agencies may try what they may, they would just not succeed. The key lengths, strengths of crypto algorithms can also be bumped up with some spare strength without knowing almost anything about the surveillance projects, because the minimum feature size of digital logic microchips and therefore their maximum computational power is public knowledge. It's obvious that the agencies have the money to create their own custom crypto breaking chips, so the key sizes that are not reachable for the agencies are kind of calculable without any leaks. [...]

Yes I agree the western democracies backed off like cowards. I believe they got used to the status quo, and western "democracies"/monarchies; people had no rights. And we knew about Echelon way back in the 70s, 80s. But for America right now,  congress is a rubber stamp, the judicial system defers to congress and the government, leaving nothing else but the executive.   Was Bush the guy that crossed the Rubicon or was it Obama, or did the fall start a long time ago? Are the good guys really the "good guys" anymore? In my opinion no.

> [aspidochelone](#comment_311_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsKABo1Z): I think Snowden's "revelations" were all stuff we knew already.  The effect was to get the courts to start using the information in court because it was no longer "secret".  He never told us about shit we know is going on, like antivirus software scanning your hard drive for secret/classified information, or mobile phones using directional antennas to watch you in your room.  And then ... he ended up hanging out in Russia as a dissident. [...]

Courts won't touch it. Look at the results of the suit against AT&T. The court said "we can't act without proof" and the government made the proof top secret. All we have is an executive who can write presidential orders and can pick justices, since congress is a rubber stamp.

1589664235_16Fw7LqBDEgoFYTkiJBsywYJRtoRR.body: So nice of them to do this while everyone is unemployed, and being denied their civil liberties cause "virus".  Well my friends, the only way the government will stop is when they do not have the resources to do so, and when left and right wing stop wanting more fucking "SAFETY". (I hate that damn word! It's an excuse for everything!) The only way that's going to happen is during struggle, strife, famine, WAR. I think instead of making laws, politicians should be finding ways to reduce laws. That was the purpose of the checks and balances...

Lets us not forget....our fallen brothers who have watched CP or downloaded cartoons of CP and gone to prison. Disgusting? Yes. Criminal? Absolutely not! Yes women are the problem, but so is bad weather, taxes, and swarms of locust; They are all forces of nature, which we must ready ourselves for. Which is why I have a camera in my car, home, bedroom, and not that Amazon or Chinese crap either. Which brings us to another topic altogether. RFID skimming. Something everyone overlooks, harmless, innocent, fast, cheap, but huge consequences down the road.
